00028 /**************************************************************************/
00052 /* this should be approx 2 Bo*oMips to start (note initial shift), and will
00053  *    still work even if initially too large, it will just take slightly longer */
00054 volatile unsigned long loops_per_jiffy = (1<<12);
00055 
00056 /* This is the number of bits of precision for the loops_per_jiffy.  Each
00057  *    bit takes on average 1.5/HZ seconds.  This (like the original) is a little
00058  *       better than 1% */
00059 #define LPS_PREC 8
00060 
00061 static void calibrate_delay(void);
00062 __STATIC_INLINE uint32_t clock(void);
00063 static void _delay( uint32_t delay);
00064 
00067 /***************************************************************************/
00071 void UDELAY_Calibrate(void)
00072 {
00073   CMU_Select_TypeDef lfaClkSel;
00074   CMU_ClkDiv_TypeDef rtcClkDiv;
00075   bool rtcRestore       = false;
00076   bool leClkTurnoff     = false;
00077   bool rtcClkTurnoff    = false;
00078   bool lfaClkSrcRestore = false;
00079   bool lfaClkTurnoff    = false;
00080 #if defined( RTCC_PRESENT ) && ( RTCC_COUNT == 1 )
00081   RTCC_Init_TypeDef init = RTCC_INIT_DEFAULT;
00082   uint32_t rtcCtrl=0, rtcIen=0;
00083 #else
00084   RTC_Init_TypeDef init = RTC_INIT_DEFAULT;
00085   uint32_t rtcCtrl=0, rtcComp0=0, rtcComp1=0, rtcIen=0;
00086 #endif
00087 
00088   /* Ensure LE modules are accessible */
00089 #if defined (_CMU_HFBUSCLKEN0_MASK)
00090   if ( !( CMU->HFBUSCLKEN0 & CMU_HFBUSCLKEN0_LE) )
00091 #else
00092   if ( !( CMU->HFCORECLKEN0 & CMU_HFCORECLKEN0_LE) )
00093 #endif
00094   {
00095     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_CORELE, true);
00096     leClkTurnoff = true;
00097   }
00098 
00099 #if defined (CMU_LFECLKEN0_RTCC)
00100   lfaClkSel = CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_LFE);
00101 #else
00102   lfaClkSel = CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_LFA);
00103 #endif
00104 
00105   #if defined( UDELAY_LFXO )
00106     if ( !(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFXOENS) )
00107     {
00108       lfaClkTurnoff = true;
00109       CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFXO, true, true);
00110     }
00111 
00112     if ( lfaClkSel != cmuSelect_LFXO )
00113     {
00114       lfaClkSrcRestore = true;
00115 #if defined (CMU_LFECLKEN0_RTCC)
00116       CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFE, cmuSelect_LFXO);
00117 #else
00118       CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, cmuSelect_LFXO);
00119 #endif
00120     }
00121 
00122   #else
00123     if ( lfaClkSel != cmuSelect_LFRCO )
00124     {
00125       lfaClkSrcRestore = true;
00126     }
00127     if ( !(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFRCOENS) )
00128     {
00129       lfaClkTurnoff = true;
00130     }
00131     /* Enable LFACLK in CMU (will also enable oscillator if not enabled) */
00132 #if defined (CMU_LFECLKEN0_RTCC)
00133     CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFE, cmuSelect_LFRCO);
00134 #else
00135     CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, cmuSelect_LFRCO);
00136 #endif
00137   #endif
00138 
00139   /* Set up a reasonable prescaler. */
00140 #if defined( RTCC_PRESENT ) && ( RTCC_COUNT == 1 )
00141   rtcClkDiv = CMU_ClockDivGet(cmuClock_RTCC);
00142   if ( !(CMU->LFECLKEN0 & CMU_LFECLKEN0_RTCC) )
00143   {
00144     /* Enable clock to RTCC module */
00145     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_RTCC, true);
00146     rtcClkTurnoff = true;
00147   }
00148 #else
00149   rtcClkDiv = CMU_ClockDivGet(cmuClock_RTC);
00150   CMU_ClockDivSet(cmuClock_RTC, cmuClkDiv_256);
00151   if ( !(CMU->LFACLKEN0 & CMU_LFACLKEN0_RTC) )
00152   {
00153     /* Enable clock to RTC module */
00154     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_RTC, true);
00155     rtcClkTurnoff = true;
00156   }
00157 #endif
00158 
00159 
00160   INT_Disable();
00161 
00162 #if defined( RTCC_PRESENT ) && ( RTCC_COUNT == 1 )
00163   if ( RTCC->CTRL & RTCC_CTRL_ENABLE )
00164   {
00165     /* Stash away current RTC settings. */
00166     rtcCtrl   = RTCC->CTRL;
00167     rtcIen    = RTCC->IEN;
00168 
00169     RTCC->CTRL = _RTCC_CTRL_RESETVALUE;
00170     RTCC->IEN  = 0;
00171     RTCC->IFC  = _RTCC_IEN_MASK;
00172 
00173     NVIC_ClearPendingIRQ( RTCC_IRQn );
00174 
00175     rtcRestore = true;
00176   }
00177   init.precntWrapOnCCV0 = false;  /* Count to max before wrapping */
00178   init.cntWrapOnCCV1 = false;  /* Count to max before wrapping */
00179   init.presc = rtccCntPresc_256; /* Setup prescaler */
00180 
00181   RTCC_Init(&init);        /* Start RTC counter. */
00182 
00183 #else
00184   if ( RTC->CTRL & RTC_CTRL_EN )
00185   {
00186     /* Stash away current RTC settings. */
00187     rtcCtrl   = RTC->CTRL;
00188     rtcComp0  = RTC->COMP0;
00189     rtcComp1  = RTC->COMP1;
00190     rtcIen    = RTC->IEN;
00191 
00192     RTC->CTRL = _RTC_CTRL_RESETVALUE;
00193     RTC->IEN  = 0;
00194     RTC->IFC  = _RTC_IEN_MASK;
00195 
00196     NVIC_ClearPendingIRQ( RTC_IRQn );
00197 
00198     rtcRestore = true;
00199   }
00200   init.comp0Top = false;  /* Count to max before wrapping */
00201 
00202   RTC_Init(&init);        /* Start RTC counter. */
00203 
00204 #endif
00205 
00206   calibrate_delay();      /* Calibrate the micro second delay loop. */
00207 
00208   INT_Enable();
00209 
00210   /* Restore all RTC related settings to how they were previously set. */
00211   if ( rtcRestore )
00212   {
00213 #if defined( RTCC_PRESENT ) && ( RTCC_COUNT == 1 )
00214     CMU_ClockDivSet(cmuClock_RTCC, rtcClkDiv);
00215     RTCC->CTRL  = rtcCtrl;
00216     RTCC->IEN   = rtcIen;
00217 #else
00218     CMU_ClockDivSet(cmuClock_RTC, rtcClkDiv);
00219     RTC_FreezeEnable(true);
00220     #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00221       RTC_Sync(RTC_SYNCBUSY_COMP0 | RTC_SYNCBUSY_COMP1 | RTC_SYNCBUSY_CTRL);
00222     #endif
00223     RTC->COMP0 = rtcComp0;
00224     RTC->COMP1 = rtcComp1;
00225     RTC->CTRL  = rtcCtrl;
00226     RTC->IEN   = rtcIen;
00227     RTC_FreezeEnable(false);
00228 #endif
00229   }
00230   else
00231   {
00232 #if defined( RTCC_PRESENT ) && ( RTCC_COUNT == 1 )
00233     RTCC_Enable(false);
00234 #else
00235     RTC_Enable(false);
00236 #endif
00237   }
00238 
00239   if ( rtcClkTurnoff )
00240   {
00241 #if defined( RTCC_PRESENT ) && ( RTCC_COUNT == 1 )
00242     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_RTCC, false);
00243 #else
00244     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_RTC, false);
00245 #endif
00246   }
00247 
00248   if ( lfaClkSrcRestore )
00249   {
00250 #if defined (CMU_LFECLKEN0_RTCC)
00251     CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFE, lfaClkSel);
00252 #else
00253     CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, lfaClkSel);
00254 #endif
00255   }
00256 
00257   if ( lfaClkTurnoff )
00258   {
00259     #if defined( UDELAY_LFXO )
00260       CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFXO, false, false);
00261     #else
00262       CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFRCO, false, false);
00263     #endif
00264   }
00265 
00266   if ( leClkTurnoff )
00267   {
00268     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_CORELE, false);
00269   }
00270 }

00272 #if defined(__GNUC__) /* GCC */
00273 /***************************************************************************/
00284 void UDELAY_Delay( uint32_t usecs )
00285 {
00286   __ASM volatile (
00287 #if ( __CORTEX_M == 0x00 )
00288 "        .syntax unified           \n"
00289 "        .arch armv6-m             \n"
00290 #endif
00291 "        cmp     %0, #0            \n"    /* Return if 0 delay. */
00292 "        beq.n   2f                \n"
00293 "        subs    %0, #1            \n"    /* Correct for off by one error. */
00294 "        movs    r2, #0x88         \n"
00295 "        lsls    r2, r2, #8        \n"
00296 "        adds    r2, #0x00         \n"
00297 "        muls    %0, r2            \n"
00298 "                                  \n"
00299 "        ldr     r2, [%1]          \n"
00300 "        movs    r0, %0, lsr #11   \n"
00301 "        movs    r2, r2, lsr #11   \n"
00302 "                                  \n"
00303 "        muls    r0, r2            \n"
00304 "        movs    r0, r0, lsr #6    \n"
00305 "                                  \n"
00306 "        beq.n   2f                \n"
00307 "                                  \n"
00308 "1:      subs    r0, #1            \n"
00309 "        bhi     1b                \n"
00310 #if ( __CORTEX_M == 0x00 )
00311 "2:                                \n"
00312 "        .syntax divided           \n" : : "r" (usecs), "r" (&loops_per_jiffy) : "r0", "r2", "cc" );
00313 #else
00314 "2:                                \n" : : "r" (usecs), "r" (&loops_per_jiffy) : "r0", "r2", "cc" );
00315 #endif
00316 }
00317 #endif /* defined(__GNUC__) */
00318 
00321 static void calibrate_delay(void)
00322 {
00323   /* From linux 2.4 source. */
00324   unsigned long loopbit;
00325   unsigned long ticks;
00326   int lps_precision = LPS_PREC;
00327 
00328   loops_per_jiffy = (1<<12);
00329 
00330   while (loops_per_jiffy <<= 1) {
00331     /* wait for "start of" clock tick */
00332     ticks = clock();
00333     while (ticks == clock())
00334       /* nothing */;
00335     /* Go .. */
00336     ticks = clock();
00337     _delay(loops_per_jiffy);
00338     ticks = clock() - ticks;
00339     if (ticks)
00340       break;
00341   }
00342 
00343   /* Do a binary approximation to get loops_per_jiffy set to equal one clock
00344      (up to lps_precision bits) */
00345 
00346   loops_per_jiffy >>= 1;
00347   loopbit = loops_per_jiffy;
00348   while ( lps_precision-- && (loopbit >>= 1) ) {
00349     loops_per_jiffy |= loopbit;
00350     ticks = clock();
00351     while (ticks == clock());
00352     ticks = clock();
00353     _delay(loops_per_jiffy);
00354     if (clock() != ticks)   /* longer than 1 tick */
00355       loops_per_jiffy &= ~loopbit;
00356   }
00357 }
00358 
00359 __STATIC_INLINE uint32_t clock(void)
00360 {
00361 #if defined( RTCC_PRESENT ) && ( RTCC_COUNT == 1 )
00362   return RTCC_CounterGet();
00363 #else
00364   return RTC_CounterGet();
00365 #endif
00366 }

00368 #if defined(__ICCARM__) /* IAR */
00369 static void _delay( uint32_t delay)
00370 {
00371   __ASM volatile (
00372 "_delay_1:                         \n"
00373 "        subs    r0, #1            \n"
00374 "        bhi.n   _delay_1          \n" );
00375 }
00376 
00377 void UDELAY_Delay( uint32_t usecs )
00378 {
00379   __ASM volatile (
00380 "        cmp     %0, #0            \n"    /* Return if 0 delay. */
00381 "        beq.n   udelay_2          \n"
00382 "        subs    %0, #1            \n"    /* Correct for off by one error. */
00383 "        movs    r2, #0x88         \n"
00384 "        lsls    r2, r2, #8        \n"
00385 "        adds    r2, #0x00         \n"
00386 "        muls    %0, r2            \n"
00387 "                                  \n"
00388 "        ldr     r2, [%1]          \n"
00389 "        movs    r0, %0, lsr #11   \n"
00390 "        movs    r2, r2, lsr #11   \n"
00391 "                                  \n"
00392 "        muls    r0, r2            \n"
00393 "        movs    r0, r0, lsr #6    \n"
00394 "                                  \n"
00395 "        beq.n   udelay_2          \n"
00396 "                                  \n"
00397 "udelay_1:                         \n"
00398 "        subs    r0, #1            \n"
00399 "        bhi.n   udelay_1          \n"
00400 "udelay_2:                         \n" : : "r" (usecs), "r" (&loops_per_jiffy) : "r0", "r2", "cc");
00401 }
00402 #endif /* defined(__ICCARM__) */
00403 
00404 #if defined(__GNUC__) /* GCC */
00405 static void _delay( uint32_t delay )
00406 {
00407   __ASM volatile (
00408 #if ( __CORTEX_M == 0x00 )
00409 "        .syntax unified           \n"
00410 "        .arch armv6-m             \n"
00411 #endif
00412 "1:      subs    %0, #1            \n"
00413 #if ( __CORTEX_M == 0x00 )
00414 "        bhi.n   1b                \n"
00415 "        .syntax divided           \n" : : "r" (delay) );
00416 #else
00417 "        bhi.n   1b                \n" : : "r" (delay) );
00418 #endif
00419 }
00420 #endif /* defined(__GNUC__) */
00421 
00422 #if defined(__CC_ARM) /* Keil */
00423 static __ASM void _delay( uint32_t delay)
00424 {
00425 _delay_1
00426         subs    r0, #1
00427         bhi     _delay_1
00428         bx      lr
00429 }
00430 
00431 __ASM void UDELAY_Delay( uint32_t usecs __attribute__ ((unused)) )
00432 {
00433         IMPORT  loops_per_jiffy
00434 
00435         cmp     r0, #0                  /* Return if 0 delay. */
00436         beq.n   udelay_2
00437         subs    r0, #1                  /* Correct for off by one error. */
00438         movs    r2, #0x88
00439         lsls    r2, r2, #8
00440         adds    r2, #0x00
00441         muls    r0, r2, r0
00442 
00443         ldr     r2, =loops_per_jiffy
00444         ldr     r2, [r2]
00445         movs    r0, r0, lsr #11
00446         movs    r2, r2, lsr #11
00447 
00448         muls    r0, r2, r0
00449         movs    r0, r0, lsr #6
00450         beq     udelay_2
00451 udelay_1
00452         subs    r0, #1
00453         bhi     udelay_1
00454 udelay_2
00455         bx      lr
00456 }
00457 #endif /* defined(__CC_ARM) */
